description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 2d8 type=cold average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} and aware of it must succeed on a [[/save wis 16 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save con 22 format=long]], taking [[/damage 16d8 type=cold average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can’t use the same effect two rounds in a row:

  • Freezing fog fills a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on a point the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can see within 120 feet of it. The fog spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. Each creature in the fog when it appears must make a [[/save con 10 format=long]], taking [[/damage 3d6 type=cold average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that ends its turn in the fog takes [[/damage 3d6 type=cold average=true]] damage. A wind of at least 20 miles per hour disperses the fog. The fog otherwise lasts until the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} uses this lair action again or until the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies.
  • Jagged ice shards fall from the ceiling, striking up to three creatures underneath that the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can see within 120 feet of it. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes one ranged attack roll (+7 to hit) against each target. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage 3d6 type=piercing average=true]] damage.
  • The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} creates an opaque wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 120 feet of it. The wall can be up to 30 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 foot thick. When the wall appears, each creature within its area is pushed 5 feet out of the wall’s space, appearing on whichever side of the wall it wants. Each 10-foot section of the wall has AC 5, 30 hit points, vulnerability to &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, and immunity to &Reference[acid]{acid}, &Reference[cold]{cold}, &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic}, &Reference[poison]{poison}, and &Reference[psychic]{psychic} damage. The wall disappears when the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} uses this lair action again or when the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regional Effects

The region containing a legendary white dragon’s lair is warped by the dragon’s magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

  • Chilly fog lightly obscures the land within 6 miles of the dragon’s lair.
  • Freezing precipitation falls within 6 miles of the dragon’s lair, sometimes forming blizzard conditions when the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} is at rest.
  • Icy walls block off areas in the dragon’s lair. Each wall is 6 inches thick, and a 10-foot section has AC 5, 15 hit points, vulnerability to &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, and immunity to &Reference[acid]{acid}, &Reference[cold]{cold}, &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic}, &Reference[poison]{poison}, and &Reference[psychic]{psychic} damage.
    If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} wishes to move through a wall, it can do so without slowing down. The portion of the wall the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} moves through is destroyed, however.

If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies, the fog and precipitation fade within 1 day. The ice walls melt over the course of 1d10 days.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A White Dragon’s Lair

White dragons lair in icy caves and deep subterranean chambers far from the sun. They favor high mountain vales accessible only by flying, caverns in cliff faces, and labyrinthine ice caves in glaciers. White dragons love vertical heights in their caverns, flying up to the ceiling to latch on like bats or slithering down icy crevasses.

A legendary white dragon’s innate magic deepens the &Reference[cold]{cold} in the area around its lair. Mountain caverns are fast frozen by the white dragon’s presence. A white &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can often detect intruders by the way the keening wind in its lair changes tone.

A white &Reference[dragon]{dragon} rests on high ice shelves and cliffs in its lair, the floor around it a treacherous morass of broken ice and stone, hidden pits, and slippery slopes. As foes struggle to move toward it, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} flies from perch to perch and destroys them with its freezing breath.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Detect. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

Tail Attack. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a tail attack.

Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 22 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 8 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 22 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 8 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Ice Walk. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
